feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 04 at 7:43AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels and Ice Shove Possible Today through Monday afternoon... A series of storms moving north through the Bering Sea and into the Southern Chukchi Sea today and Monday will bring very strong south winds gusting as high as 75 mph today and tonight to outer coastal areas along with elevated water levels.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Additional snow accumulation up to 2 inches and ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Chukchi Sea Coast.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 04 at 4:01AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Sea Levels Sunday Night Through Tuesday... Water levels will begin rising along the Arctic Coast from Utqiagvik west on Sunday night, with the highest levels expected on Monday. Water may push up on top of the sea ice, and could cause ice to pile up on beaches from Utqiagvik west. No infrastructure flooding is expected at this time. Residents with
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Arctic Coast; Western Arctic Coast

entry.title: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 04 at 3:48AM AKST until December 05 at 3:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 3 AM AKST MONDAY... * LOCATION...Bristol Bay near Togiak. * COASTAL FLOODING...Water levels are expected to rise 2 to 4 feet above normal highest tide. * TIMING...9 AM Sunday to 3 AM AKST Monday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 3:02PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREA CREEKS EXPECTED TO REMAIN HIGH THROUGH THE WEEKEND... Recent cold temperatures have caused area rivers and streams to increase in stage due to freeze-up. Localized ice dams have formed on Peter`s Creek near Stoltze Bridge, as well as Campbell Creek in Far North Bicentennial Park near Basher Dr. Localized bankfull conditions to minor flooding have been reported in these

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 04 at 3:55AM CST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areal Flooding and River Flooding is Possible This Week... A frontal boundary that moved across the area on Saturday, will return northward as a warm front Monday, then become stationary in a west to east orientation over or near the Tennessee Valley this week. A series of systems moving along this boundary will bring numerous to widespread showers, along with a few thunderstorms to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Colbert; Cullman; DeKalb; Franklin; Jackson; Lauderdale; Lawrence; Limestone; Madison; Marshall; Morgan

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued December 03 at 8:27AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT: MANDATORY WOOD BURNING CURTAILMENT IN EFFECT... The Imperial County APCD has declared a mandatory wood burning curtailment for residents within the Calexico area for Saturday, December 3rd, 2022 and Sunday, December 4th, 2022. The declaration of a Mandatory curtailment, when forecast indicate elevated levels of fine particulate air pollution in the region, is

entry.title: Flood Warning issued December 04 at 7:48AM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor remains in Minor Flood stage. It is forecast to continue a very slow fall while remaining within Minor Flood stage for the foreseeable future. Residents and interests along the river will continue to see Minor flood impacts.
